website_summaries.verdict: The Virgin Mobile TNT is a solid choice for a basic, communication-focused phone. It's a bargain, too.
pros: The Virgin Mobile TNT has a compact, simple design and satisfying call quality
Its feature set includes voice dialing and a speakerphone
cons: The Virgin Mobile TNT's voice quality is slightly tinny
Also, its external display is tiny

customer_reviews.title: Battery life incredible
customer_reviews.text: I needed something a little better than the really old phone I'd bought years ago for emergencies and got something much better for great price. Iphones and others of that level don't appeal to me; I already own a computer, a camera, and so on and just wanted a way to make a call when needed. I don't need a 2-year contract with a phone company. This phone rarely needs charging since I do not leave it on all the time. When I need it, it is ready to go on and do its job. The sound is clear, the connections quick, and areas of use pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: P Goodwin

customer_reviews.title: best gift for grandma
customer_reviews.text: My grandma asked for this because her last one broke. She said she loves it because it is very simple without a whole lot "fancy hoopla". She said she just want to answer and make calls going out, thats it!
customer_reviews.author: Ognam Stoob

customer_reviews.title: Great Cell Phone to Buy for Older Relatives
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my mother and set it up in a few minutes. Big keys, easy to use menu, and pre-paid options that include low cost / infrequent top ups, all make this a great choice for an older relative who just wants a basic low cost cell phone and will use it only occasionally.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Glad to get the last one....
customer_reviews.text: My mom had this flip phone for years and Really liked it. It was accidentally broken so I replaced it for her. This was the last one in stock that I found glad to get it
customer_reviews.author: nickelmac

customer_reviews.title: Simple phone for a no frills need !
customer_reviews.text: It was every thing I expected and wanted. Simple functional easy to carry in a shirt pocket.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth G. Blair

customer_reviews.title: Which phone provider will activate this Kyocera TNT phone?
customer_reviews.text: I have this phone, but not sure which provider is willing to activate it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: TEXTERS BEWARE
customer_reviews.text: I bought this phone @ radio shack for $21 and i thought that was a great price because it was my first phone. my intention was to use it mostly for texting and make a calls every now and then. this phone is superb if you text sometimes and mainly use it for calling. but if text a lot this phone will be horrible for you! every time you're in the middle of texting and when there's an incoming text, the text you would be working on would be automatically sent to draft. every time.there's no stopping it and it gets SO ANNOYING!
customer_reviews.author: amanda l

customer_reviews.title: Great Phone for the price
customer_reviews.text: Hello, this phone is great for what I need it for; to make and recieve phone calls. I don't need a camera or everything data, which it doesn't have. I didn't have to pay alot for this phone and it fits in my pocket and it is durable, this is great for me because I'm always on the go.
customer_reviews.author: TYK72

customer_reviews.title: nnot so much
customer_reviews.text: PPhone worked for 3 days then ear speaker went and you had to talk on speaker the whole time. woyldnt recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: aavigrl2011

customer_reviews.title: Typical cheap sprint offering
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. VirginMobile (owned by Sprint) markets this phone along with others to what it thinks is a hip young crowd with little money. Just the interface they use is completely inane. Don't even bother trying to read or enter text unless you have perfect vision or are under 30.You gotta be poor to go with Sprint's "cheaper" Virginmobile.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Gummy

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Overall good product. Very lightweight and love the soft feeling the outside of the phone has. The back cover is very tricky to get off.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Worst experience
customer_reviews.text: This phone is simple and compact like I wanted but it is not what was advertised on the package. Virgin Mobile is incompetent so I am returning for another company. Simple as that. I won't put up with these companies that promise everything and deliver the opposite.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Antonietti

product_meta.title: Kyocera TNT Prepaid Phone (Virgin Mobile)
product_meta.description: This is the Virgin Mobile Black TNT! Soft Touch Flip Cell Phone. With Virgin Mobile, You Pay Only For The Calling Time You Use. You Can Choose A Plan That's Based Just On Minutes Or A Monthly Plan With No Annual Contract (With Select Plans Offering Unlimited Calling On Weekends And After 7pm On Weekdays). Additionally, You Can Choose From A Variety Of Mobile Messaging Plans, Which Includes Text Messaging, Email, And IM. Virgin Mobile USA's National Coverage Is Powered By The Nationwide Sprint PCS Network. No Annual Contracts Or Roaming Charges. No Credit Checks, No Activation Fees.
feature_bullets: TNT! Soft Touch Flip Fone - Black or Blue - Check Listing Details for Color
CDMA Network Compatibility No Annual Contracts
